Package com.cafean.jobstream.common.components

Class ApplicationDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.jobstream.common.components.ApplicationDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ApplicationDefinition>
    public class ApplicationDefinition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ApplicationDefinition>, java.io.Serializable
    This class is the in-memory representation an application definition read from site configuration. It is held in memory by Stream Plugin as a lookup for selecting an application. It is also written to the Stream Definition at submit time and used in memory by the Stream Manager. And finally, it is written to the Task Definition and used by the Execution Wrapper.
    See Also:
    PlatformDefinition, ApplicationInput, ApplicationOutput, ApplicationSetup, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ApplicationDefinition()
      Creates a new empty Application Definition

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getApplicationPath

        public java.lang.String getApplicationPath()
        Returns this definition's "path" which is comprised of the name of the group that contains it (if any) followed by its name. Applications defined in the user's "Personal Settings" have an empty group and thus use only their name for their path. Platforms in the Global site configuration use a path of the form [Group]/[Application].
        Returns:
        a String containing this definition's path

      • read

        public boolean read​(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Reads the contents of this application definition from the given XML DOM tree "application" Element.
        Parameters:
        element - the Element containing an application that should be read into this ApplicationDefinition.
        Returns:
        true for success; false for failure

      • writePythonApp

        public void writePythonApp​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           int indent)
        Writes the contents of this application definition to the given PrintWriter in XML format as a 'python' element rather than the normal 'application' element. This is intended to be used when storing a python application reference in a task definition.
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter to which the application should be written
        indent - the number of spaces to indent the "application" tag
        See Also:
        XMLUtils.getIndent()

      • writePyPostApp

        public void writePyPostApp​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                           int indent)
        Writes the contents of this application definition to the given PrintWriter in XML format as a 'pypost' element rather than the normal 'application' element. This is intended to be used when storing a pypost application reference in a task definition.
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter to which the application should be written
        indent - the number of spaces to indent the "application" tag
        See Also:
        XMLUtils.getIndent()

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Retrieves the type of this application. The application type corresponds to the "AppType" of JSStep and WrapperModule.

      • getVersion

        public ApplicationVersion getVersion()
        Returns the version of the application. Job steps that do not support the selection of ApplicationVersions will typically have an empty version.

        Returns:

      • storeState

        public void storeState​(java.lang.String prefix,
                       java.util.Hashtable state)
        Stores the state of the ApplicationDefinition to permit undo.
        Parameters:
        state - a Hashtable in which to place containing modified parameters.
        prefix - a String containing the prefix of this definition's entries.

        Restores the state of the ApplicationDefinition from an earlier edit.
        Parameters:

        prefix - a String containing the prefix of this definition's entries.
